analytic.title: Le Caché nous relève en se révélant. La révélation rédemptrice dans les Hymnes sur la Nativité de St. Éphrem

biblStruct.note: This is the second of two articles discussing the revelatory aspect of divine redemption in Ephrem’s Hymns on the Nativity. Complementary to the detailed study of the third hymn of this collection (OCP 77 [2011] 351-398), this article presents the results of a comparative study of recurrent terms in the whole collection on the Nativity, making references to Ephrem’s entire oeuvre. The first part examines three terminological groups concerning the revelatory aspect of redemption, namely ksy’/gly’; dnš’; and lbwš’/’sṭl šwbḥ’. The second part focuses on three terminological groups emphasizing the redemptive aspect of revelation, namely ’rkn/nḥt/z‘r; ḥyl’; phgr’. Finally, a synthesis of both articles collects their results, as the importance of verbs in Ephrem’s poetical theology, the centrality of ḥyl’, and the omnipresence of revelation in the Hymns of the Nativity. For Ephrem, God remains the absolute hidden Mystery, who noetically reveals Godself through a Christological aesthetics, pedagogically adapted to our senses, and soteriologically uplifting, giving us life.
